Name: Part of a Vault Ceiling in Plaster
Description: In the middle of this part of a vault ceiling made of colored plaster, a rhombus is surrounded with geometric shapes of rhombi and squares. A rhombus is a four-sided polygon with equal and parallel sides. Floral drawings are depicted inside these shapes. In the middle of the drawing, there is an octagon with four short sides. Each of them forms one side of four squares. On the left, there is a vertical row of four squares, whose sides are marked in black. Inside each one there is a central square with leaves or floral shapes in the middle. This piece is currently placed on the floor of the hall of the Greco-Roman Museum. Its colors are very faded.
